page.title: 20Chew Stoke Church (cont.)
page.content: Chew Stoke Church although overall dedication is to St. Andrew has a unique dedication within it; the South Transept recalls the legend of { {WILGEFORTH}a daughter of a one time heathen{King of Portugal.}The princess had been converted to Christianity and was very distressed when she discovered that her father had plans for her to marry an unbeliever: wishing neither to marry him nor to disobey her father she prayed to God that she be disfigured and so made unattractive to men. She was given a beard and her suitor was so frightened he went away and her enraged father had her beheaded, possibly because he was afraid of the powers within her. How part of Chew Stoke Church came to be dedicated to St. Wilgeforth or the "Maid Uncumber" as she is sometimes known is a mystery.
